page.title: 20Stonegate's changing face
page.content: In 1985 many changes are taking place in Stonegate.Owing to increased mechanisation,fewer people are employed on the farms.Farm workers have had to seek alternative employment,often away from the village.Their places have been taken in the village by commuters,who rely on train services or private cars to take them to work in London or other towns.Many farm buildings,especially oast houses and barns,have been redeveloped as dwellings. The railway has relied upon diesel- powered locomotives for many years,but in 1985 preparations are being made for the electrification of the line.
